intro: Borneacanthus parvus, commonly known as the small-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. It has a short stem with smooth, waxy bark and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
